original_query: "Find the top 3 trending news articles on BBC and summarize them in bullet points"

perception.result_requirement: A bullet-point summary of the top 3 trending news articles from BBC.
perception.reasoning: The user wants a summary of the top 3 trending news articles from BBC. This requires fetching the news articles and then summarizing them. This is not directly achievable without using tools.
perception.local_reasoning: The initial query needs to be broken down into subtasks: 1) find the top 3 trending news articles on BBC, 2) summarize them in bullet points.

plan_text: Step 0: Search DuckDuckGo to find the top 3 trending news articles on BBC.
Step 1: Convert the URLs of the top 3 articles into markdown using convert_webpage_url_into_markdown.
Step 2: Summarize each article in bullet points and combine the summaries.

steps.description: Search DuckDuckGo to find the top 3 trending news articles on BBC.

tool_arguments.code:
result = duckduckgo_search_results("top 3 trending news articles on BBC", 3)
return result

plan_text: Step 0: Search DuckDuckGo for "BBC trending news articles" to get specific trending articles.
Step 1: Convert the URLs of the top 3 articles into markdown using convert_webpage_url_into_markdown.
Step 2: Summarize each article in bullet points and combine the summaries.

steps.description: Convert the URLs of the top 3 articles into markdown using convert_webpage_url_into_markdown.

tool_arguments.code:
urls = ["https://www.bbc.com/news", "https://www.bbc.co.uk/news", "https://www.bbc.com/news/world"]
markdown_contents = await parallel(("convert_webpage_url_into_markdown", urls[0]), ("convert_webpage_url_into_markdown", urls[1]), ("convert_webpage_url_into_markdown", urls[2]))
return markdown_contents
